content: hazel the humpback by bec brittain © 2010 the pattern uses only simple stitches and increases the only tricky thing is keeping track of where you are since almost every row is different it helps to think of the top side of the head and the bottom ribbed side separately as such i ve placed this character in between the top and the bottom for every row i worked the contrasting color using a circular intarsia technique i didn t keep track of it every whale has a different pattern of light color so there s no messing it up uses 300-340 yards of dk weight yarn on #3 needles finished whale is 26 long of course you could scale up and down as you please with different weight yarn body make sure to stuff while the opening is still big enough and then right before closing top off the tip of the tail cast on 6 stitches divide on 3 or 4 dp needles and join in the round 1 knit all stitches 6 kfb 4 times cid 129 p k mil k2 mil k kfb k2 2 k m1r k cid 129 p mir k m1r k mir p mir k2 mir k p 3 k3 cid 129 p k5 p 7 k8 cid 129 p k15 p 4 k kfb k cid 129 p m1l k kfb 3 times k m1r p 8 k8 cid 129 p k3 mil k2 mil k2 kfb k2 m1r k2 5 k4 cid 129 p k10 p m1r k3 p 1 of 8 9 k8 cid 129 p k9 k2tog k9 p 28 k m1l k18 m1r k cid 129 p k2 p2 twice k2 p 10 k m1l k6 m1r k cid 129 p k4 4 times p m1l p k2 p2 k2 p m1r p k2 p2 k2 p 11 k10 cid 129 p k4 p k2 mil p mil k p k mir p m1r p k2 p2 twice k2 p mir k2 p k4 p 29 k22 cid 129 p k2 p2 twice k2 p3 k2 p2 k2 p3 12 k10 cid 129 p k4 p k3 p k2 p k2 p k3 p k4 p k2 p2 k2 p3 k2 p2 twice k2 p 13 k m1l k8 m1r k cid 129 p k m1l p k2 p k 30 k m1r k20 mil k cid 129 p k2 p2 twice k2 p3 m1l k2 p ssk p k2tog p k2 m1r k p k2 k2 p2 k2 p m1l kfb p m1r k2 p2 k2 p3 p m1r k p k2 p2 twice k2 p 14 k12 cid 129 p k2 twice p k4 p k twice p k4 p 31 k24 cid 129 p k2 p2 twice k2 p3 k2 p2 4 times k2 twice p k2 p3 k2 p2 twice k2 p 15 k12 cid 129 p k2 twice p2 k3 p k twice p k3 32 k11 kfb kfb k11 cid 129
